channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The parking is too close to the junction so can’t see around cars when cycling, 27th June
item.description:
The cars are parked close to the junction of cooper/mawbrey and causes issues with sight lines and seen a cyclist nearly hit because of this and vehicles going too fast. If one parking bay could be removed it would improve the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cooper's Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed bulky collection reference 89120 - flytipping, 27th June
item.description:
This furniture was dumped by departing tenants in front of 446-51 Allendale Close although it has a Southwark Council bulky waste collection reference number 89120 for Monday 23 June 2025 which has been missed. Could this please be removed as a matter of urgency please. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allendale Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish in Crown passage, 27th June
item.description:
The bin have been put in crown passage without any permission. Before they were kept in their own alley way. This is from the restaurant Pirana and Byron house. It is terrible smell and it effects the passage as it’s already small it create a dirty ambience and its affecting my restaurant. Our customers and refusing to come as they say the passage is too dirty. I need someone to come and report this problem immediately. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Passage, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle has so far been here for 6 weeks, 27th June
item.description:
I have called the number every day and no one answers any contact online gets no response a number I found through company house goes through to a woman who as soon as you mention the vehicle she starts saying no no no no no then hangs the phone up they are not residents of this area no one has been to the vehicle for 6 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purneys Road, Well Hall, London

item.title: Veolia bin left behind again, 27th June
item.description:
For the second week running, Veolia have left the big black open top bin they use to collect paper or food etc waste (before tipping it into the bin lorry) on the corner of my street. Last week it was blocking the pavement. This week it's in our flower bed. Not sure why this has happened twice and never before. The service is normally excellent and your teams have been doing a great job despite the heat!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Orchard Grove, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping agains, 27th June
item.description:
There are bins nearby. I do not understand why the heck people are fly tipping

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Buckland Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Keylocks attached to railing of a public space, 27th June
item.description:
There are two keylocks attached to the railing of the flowerbed located between Cumberland Street, Cumberland Court and Winchester Street. They look like those used for private short-term rentals, so we think they should not be attached to a public railing. Besides, if they have been attached there, rather than to the entrance of a house, they are probably from a non-authorised rental activity. We think they should be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchester Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet
